sourceDesc.p: Information on named entities in this file has been extracted from files in the Digital Mitford Archive.

bibl.title: Poems
bibl.note: 1 volume.

bibl.title: Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions
bibl.note: 2 volumes.

bibl.title: To the Hon. William Herbert
Poems
bibl.note: 1810 poem; serves as dedication to the volume and appears before the Table of Contents (iii-iv). Signed Mary Russell Mitford. Bertram House, Feb. 20, 1810. This title also published in Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions.

bibl.title: Sybille. A Northumbrian Tale.
Poems
bibl.note: 1810 narrative poem. Mitford's introductory argument indicates that she wrote this poem at the request of a near relation who wished me to compose a Tale adapted to the picturesque and enchanting scenery of the ancient domains of our family, now in the possession of Bertram Mitford, Esq. The Lord de Bertram, (one of the followers of William the Conqueror) married Sybille, the heiress of Sir Johannes de Mitford, and died, I believe, in the Holy Land. This title also published in Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions.

bibl.title: On Revisiting the School Where I was Educated. Addressed to Mrs. Rowden, of Hans Place.
Poems
bibl.note: 1810 poem addressed to Mitford's friend and former teacher Frances Rowden, referring to the St. Quintin School where she was educated. This title also published in Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions.

bibl.title: To the Evening Primrose.
Poems
bibl.note: 1810 poem. This title also published in Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions.

bibl.title: Written in a Favorite Bower, Previous to Leaving Home, May 14, 1809.
Poems
bibl.note: 1810 poem refers to Mitford's home Bertram House and is dated May 14, 1809. This title also published in Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions.

bibl.title: To the Glow-Worm.
Poems
bibl.note: 1810 poem. This title also published in Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions.

bibl.title: Lines, Suggested by the Uncertain Fate of Mungo Park, the Celebrated African Traveller.
Poems
bibl.note: 1810 poem. This title also published in Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions.

bibl.title: Verses, Sent with Some Primroses to a Young Lady, who had Promised us a Visit Early in the Spring. Feb. 7, 1808.
Poems
bibl.note: 1810 poem. This title also published in Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions.

bibl.title: To the Hon. Miss Murray, with Miss Rowden's "Poetical Introduction to Botany."
Poems
bibl.note: 1810 poem. This title also published in Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions.

bibl.title: The Night of May. To Miss W--
Poems
bibl.note: 1810 poem. This title also published in Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions.

bibl.title: To my Father, on his Return from Bocking. May 29, 1808.
Poems
bibl.note: 1810 poem. This title also published in Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions.

bibl.title: Sonnet, On Being Requested to Write on Scottish Scenery.
Poems
bibl.note: 1810 sonnet. This title also published in Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions.

bibl.title: To my Beloved Mother, On Her Birth-Day, June 15, 1808.
Poems
bibl.note: 1810 poem. This title also published in Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions.

bibl.title: On Maria's Winning the Cup, At the Ilsley Coursing Meeting. November 9, 1808. Inscribed to W. Cobbett, Esq.
Poems
bibl.note: 1810 poem. This title not republished in Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions.

bibl.title: To G. L. Wardle, Esq., on the Death of His Child.
Poems
bibl.note: 1810 poem. This title not republished in Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions.

bibl.title: To Mr. Pratt.
Poems
bibl.note: 1810 poem. This title not republished in Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions.

bibl.title: Impromptu, On Hearing Mr. Whitbread Declare, On Lord Melville's Trial, That He Fondly Trusted his Name Would Descend with Honor to Posterity.
Poems
bibl.note: 1810 poem. This title not republished in Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions.

bibl.title: Prologue, Intended to Have Been Spoken Before the First Part of Henry the Fourth, Acted by the Gentlemen of the Reading School Meeting, October 23, 1809. Inscribed to the Rev. Dr. Valpy.
Poems
bibl.note: 1810 poem. This title also published in Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions.

bibl.title: To a Yellow Butterfly. April 8, 1808.
Poems
bibl.note: 1810 poem. This title also published in Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions. It first appeared in La Belle Assemblée Vol. 3 (1807): 49.

bibl.title: Winter Scenery. January, 1809.
Poems
bibl.note: 1810 poem. This title also published in Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions. This poem reprinted in British Women Poets of the Romantic Era, ed. Paula Feldman (455).

bibl.title: To Cheerfulness.
Poems
bibl.note: 1810 poem. This title also published in Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions.

bibl.title: To The Memory of Sir John Moore.
Poems
bibl.note: 1810 poem. This title also published in Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions. Barbara Hofland employs the first four lines of this poem as a chapter epigraph in volume 3 of her Tales of the Priory (33).

Poems
bibl.note: 1810 poem. This title also published in Poems: Second Edition with Considerable Additions.

bibl.title: Masque of the Seasons: A Dramatic Sketch

bibl.note: Dramatic sketch. Reprinted in volume two of The Dramatic Works of Mary Russell Mitford (1854).

bibl.title: The Captive: A Dramatic Sketch
Dramatic Scenes, Sonnets, and Other Poems
bibl.note: Dramatic sketch. Reprinted in volume two of The Dramatic Works of Mary Russell Mitford (1854).

bibl.title: Bridal Eve: A Dramatic Sketch
Dramatic Scenes, Sonnets, and Other Poems
bibl.note: Dramatic sketch. Appeared in Forget Me Not, a Christmas and New Year's present for 1827 (pp. 363+, 12 pages). Reprinted in volume two of The Dramatic Works of Mary Russell Mitford (1854).

bibl.title: Henry Talbot: A Dramatic Sketch
Dramatic Scenes, Sonnets, and Other Poems
bibl.note: Dramatic sketch. Reprinted in volume two of The Dramatic Works of Mary Russell Mitford (1854).

bibl.title: Alice: A Dramatic Sketch
Dramatic Scenes, Sonnets, and Other Poems
bibl.note: Dramatic sketch. Appeared in Forget Me Not, a Christmas and New Year's present for 1826 (pp. 5+, 12 pages) as Alice: A Dramatic Scene. Reprinted in volume two of The Dramatic Works of Mary Russell Mitford (1854).

bibl.title: Fair Rosamund: A Dramatic Sketch
Dramatic Scenes, Sonnets, and Other Poems
bibl.note: Dramatic sketch. Reprinted in volume two of The Dramatic Works of Mary Russell Mitford (1854).

bibl.title: The Painter's Daughter: A Dramatic Sketch
Dramatic Scenes, Sonnets, and Other Poems
bibl.note: Dramatic sketch. Reprinted in volume two of The Dramatic Works of Mary Russell Mitford (1854).

bibl.title: The Wedding Ring: A Dramatic Sketch
Dramatic Scenes, Sonnets, and Other Poems
bibl.note: Dramatic sketch. Appeared in Forget Me Not, a Christmas and New Year's present for 1828 (p. 79). Reprinted in volume two of The Dramatic Works of Mary Russell Mitford (1854).

bibl.title: The Fawn: A Dramatic Sketch
Dramatic Scenes, Sonnets, and Other Poems
bibl.note: Dramatic sketch. Reprinted in volume two of The Dramatic Works of Mary Russell Mitford (1854).

bibl.title: Cunigonda's Vow: A Dramatic Sketch
Dramatic Scenes, Sonnets, and Other Poems
bibl.note: Dramatic sketch. Reprinted in volume two of The Dramatic Works of Mary Russell Mitford (1854).

bibl.title: Emily, A Dramatic Sketch
Dramatic Scenes, Sonnets, and Other Poems
bibl.note: Dramatic sketch. Appeared in the London Magazine 3.17 (May 1821): 499-505. Later reprinted in Dramatic Scenes, Sonnets, and Other Poems (83-105). Also reprinted in volume two of The Dramatic Works of Mary Russell Mitford (1854).

bibl.title: The Siege
Dramatic Scenes, Sonnets, and Other Poems
bibl.note: Dramatic sketch which appeared in Lady's Magazine of September 30, 1822:462-66 as Claudia's Dream. Retitled as The Siege in Dramatic Scenes, Sonnets, and Other Poems. Appeared in the 1827 Friendship's Offering (pp. 290+, 10 pages) as The Siege: A Dramatic Scene. Also reprinted in volume two of The Dramatic Works of Mary Russell Mitford (1854).

bibl.title: Dramatic Scenes, Sonnets, and Other Poems

org.note: G. B. Whittaker was a publishing firm located in London, founded and run by George Byrom Whittaker, who was also a bookseller. George published under this firm name as well as under G. & W. B. Whittaker, the firm founded and run by George and his brother William Budd Whittaker. Source: WorldCat.
